alert.note: Alert for Hooker; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cherry, northern Hooker and western Thomas Counties through 400 PM CDT/300 PM MDT/... At 315 PM CDT/215 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Mullen, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Seneca, Hecla, Kelso and Weir. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 168 and 195. Highway 97 between mile markers 63 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT/900 PM MDT/ for north central and west central Nebraska.
